pullRequest.title: add possibility to run sensitivity analysis whithout contengencies
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: Jérémy LABOUS jlabous@silicom.fr
Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (please use '[x]' to check the checkboxes, or submit the PR and then click the checkboxes)

 The commit message follows our guidelines
 Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
 Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

Does this PR already have an issue describing the problem ? If so, link to this issue using '#XXX' and skip the rest
fix #1528

commit.message:
add possibility to run sensitivity analysis whithout contengencies

Signed-off-by: Jérémy LABOUS <jlabous@silicom.fr>

nodes.bodyText:
Please keep the same order for the parameters. You also have to update the runAsync with all the parameters to assert that the contingenciesProvider is not null.
Don't forget to add the breaking change label.
Same remark about the parameter order

I think, if the contingency list is empty we should use the short-time execution computation manager.
@murgeyseb Do you agree?
Same remark about the parameter order
Same remark about the parameter order

Same remark about the parameter order. It seems that all the runAsync methods are missing.
@murgeyseb Do we add them all? Only some of them? I think we should be symmetrical and provide only part of them (the most useful) but in sync/async modes

commit.message:
take remarks in account

Signed-off-by: Jérémy LABOUS <jlabous@silicom.fr>

nodes.bodyText: These methods should call the corresponding runAsync method without adding new parameters
As we ask in the review, can you add all missing runAsync method please?
